title: Bougrier 2015 Alain de la Treille Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
description: In a ripe, tropical style of Sauvignon Blanc, this full wine conveys white peach and pineapple, rounded and fruity. The aftertaste has an attractive tang and zest of acidity. Drink now.

title: Mulderbosch 2015 Rosé Cabernet Sauvignon (Western Cape)
description: An upfront note of chalky minerality leads the bouquet of this brightly hued rosé, supported by a core of strawberry, cherry and tropical fruit tones. Hints of carnation and sweet pea add depth to the nose, while the palate offers more herbal shadings of blackcurrant leaf and strawberry hull, which finish slightly bitter.

title: Rumelia Wine Cellar 2012 Merul Reserve Merlot (Thracian Valley)
description: Scents of perfumed lilac talc, vanilla and smoked meats frame the red and black fruit core of this wine. The medium-length finish has lingering flavors of ripe black cherries.

title: Parmoleto 2011  Montecucco
description: The nose delivers subtle aromas of vanilla and red plum while the palate shows sour cherry and toasted notes. Close-grained tannins leave an astringent, mouth-drying finish.

title: SassodiSole 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: This straightforward red opens with aromas of blue flower, forest floor and dark-skinned berry. The fresh simple palate offers tart cherry and dark spice alongside zesty acidity and mouth-puckering but fleeting tannins.

title: Lone Birch 2015 Rosé (Yakima Valley)
description: This pale pink wine is 100% Sangiovese and offers aromas of herb and sour cherry. It drinks just a hair off dry, with mouthwatering fruit flavors.

title: Glenora 2015 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)
description: Earthy pollen and dusty mineral notes extend from nose to finish on this slightly rustic Gewürztraminer, casting a shadow to more classic tones of lychee, rose petal and grapefruit. Its delicate body and balanced alcohol lend a refreshing quaffability.

title: Hector Wine Company 2014 Riesling (Seneca Lake)
description: Pressed apples and pears are accented by hints of orange rind in this juicy concentrated Riesling. It's semi dry in style, honeyed and plush, but balanced neatly by a brisk streak of lemon-lime acidity. Drink now through 2019.

title: Keuka Spring 2015 Lemberger (Finger Lakes)
description: Straightforward sour cherry and red-plum flavors are delicately concentrated in this light-footed Lemberger. Pretty floral notes and bright acidity lend to its fresh easy-drinking style. Very fine feathery tannins cushion a moderately long finish. Drink now through 2020.

title: Fournier Père et Fils 2015 Les Belles Vignes Rosé (Sancerre)
description: This attractively pale-colored rosé has ripe red fruits and crisp acidity in just the right proportions. It is soft, fruity with a lightly crisp texture and a bright, lively aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Fenestra 2012 Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)
description: Tasting mature and mellow, this deceptively full-bodied wine has sun-baked aromas, prune and dried-cherry flavors, and a smooth texture. It's lightly tart on the finish.

title: Domaine du Petit Coteau NV  Vouvray
description: The vineyard of this estate, on the first slope above the River Loire, has produced a dry while honeyed wine. Fresh pear contrasts with lemon acidity and a light texture. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Domaine les Fils de René Quénard 2015 Les Cantates Chignin Jacquère (Savoie)
description: Chignin is one of the cru villages of Savoie. This wine is crisp, mineral and tight, with delicate layers of lemon and grapefruit acidity. Lively and bursting with fruit, it's ready to drink.
winery: Domaine les Fils de René Quénard

title: Domeniile Sahateni 2014 Nomad Dealurie Munteniei Pinot Noir (Dealu Mare)
description: Cherry cola, violets and aromas of Dr. Pepper soda lead the way to flavors of tart cherry pie and cherry juice. The tannins are slightly astringent and the finish is pleasantly tart.

title: Domìni Veneti 2010 Vigneti di Jago  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)
description: This has aromas suggesting leafy underbrush, menthol and dark spice. The robust one-dimensional palate offers dried fig, raisin, clove and a green note of powdered sage. Raspy tannins and the heat of evident alcohol dominate the astringent finish.

title: Jones of Washington 2014 Estate Vineyards Chardonnay (Wahluke Slope)
description: Coming from a warm site in a warm vintage, this wine offers aromas of butter and baked apple. The palate yields lightly creamy flavors. The concentration is pulled back but what's there is quite pretty.

title: Alfredo Roca 2015 Fincas Torrontés (Mendoza)
description: Tropical fruit and lemony aromas are reasonably crisp, while this is showing some fade and flab on the palate. Flavors of green melon and banana are slightly bitter across a wide, oily feeling finish. Drink immediately.

title: Argiano 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: Aromas of menthol, dark berry, cellar floor and a whiff of humid underbrush lead the nose. Reflecting the cool, wet vintage, the light-bodied palate is a bit diluted, offering dark cherry and a hint of anise alongside vibrant acidity and close-grained, loose-knit tannins.

title: Assolati 2012 Riserva  (Montecucco)
description: The rather shy nose delivers aromas of leather, stewed fruit and a balsamic note. The round no-frills palate is somewhat evolved, offering prune and dried cherry accompanied by mellow tannins.

title: Billsboro 2015 Mousseux Sawmill Creek Vineyard Sparkling (Finger Lakes)
description: Dusty mineral notes accent fresh lemon rind and blossom aromas on this dry-style Riesling sparkler. Stark acidity feels a bit severe on the palate, juxtaposed by a bold frothing mousse full of big slightly loose bubbles.

title: Villa Spinosa 2012  Amarone della Valpolicella
description: This opens with aromas of spirits, underbrush, menthol and dried tobacco leaf. The assertive palate displays dried sour cherry, raisin and licorice alongside astringent tannins. It lacks fruit richness while scorching alcohol dominates the finish.

title: Casto Oaks 2013 Man's Best Blend Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: This hearty, firm-textured wine is very dark in color and saturated with ripe cherry, tart cranberry and boysenberry flavors. Dry and rather tannic, it needs a robust dish to pair with.

title: Cave Cooperative du Vendômois 2015 Lieu-dit Cocagne Rosé (Coteaux du Vendômois)
description: Made from 100% Pineau d'Aunis (a local grape that originated in Saumur in the 11th century) this is a soft wine. With attractive acidity, red-berry fruits and a gentle texture, the wine is ripe while keeping a backbone of mineral texture. Drink now.

title: Bootstrap 2014 Red (California)
description: This is a medium-bodied, plummy-tasting wine with mild raspberry, smoke and black-pepper flavors. Lighter than some, it's easy to enjoy.

title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2014 Les Maladières  (Bourgogne)
description: Light tannins and attractive red-berry fruits give this wine its instant appeal. It is soft, fruity, with a juicy, crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Vini 2015 Veni Vidi Vici Merlot (Thracian Valley)
description: This garnet-colored Merlot has aromas of black plum, cherry and saddle leather which pave the way for soft flavors of raspberry, red plum and a smooth tannic finish.

title: Saint Gregory 2013 Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: This wine has a floral, almost sweet aroma, followed by tasty, tangy cherry and raspberry flavors and a lip-smacking finish.

title: Villa Girardi 2012  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
description: This opens with aromas of cellar floor, moist underbrush, dried sage and a whiff of crushed violet. The robust but straightforward palate offers mature black cherry and a hint of dark cooking spice alongside close-grained rather fleeting tannins that leave a raspy finish.

title: Vini 2015 Veni Vidi Vici Cabernet Sauvignon (Thracian Valley)
description: Easygoing and not too complex this straightforward Cabernet Sauvignon offers aromas and flavors of red cherry, plum and black currant. The finish is medium length with persistent soft tannins.

title: Tenute Silvio Nardi 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: Red berry and blue flower aromas lead the way on this easy-drinking red. Light and simple, the slim palate has delicate nuances of strawberry and a hint of dark spice alongside relaxed tannins and bright acidity. Drink soon.
